intro: Weihea gerrardii, commonly known as the Tahitian breadfruit tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to the Society Islands of French Polynesia and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and smooth, gray bark. The tree produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into edible, starchy fruits resembling bread. It plays an important role in the traditional agriculture and cuisine of the Polynesian people. The plant is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal.
